entity.name: OpenCRVS Limited
entity.description: OpenCRVS Limited is a not-for-profit organisation based in the UK. It's mission is to make high-quality, cost-effective open-source civil registration technologies available in all low-resource countries so that the registration of life events becomes easy and valuable for everyone. The vision is that every person on the planet is recognised, protected, and provided for from birth.

projects.name: OpenCRVS Product Development
projects.description: OpenCRVS is an open-source, configurable digital civil registration system designed for low- and middle-income countries. It enables efficient, secure, and reliable registration of births, deaths, marriages, and other life events. OpenCRVS supports legal identity, vital statistics, and can be adapted to meet the specific needs of different country contexts.

plans.name: Global Support Team Plan
plans.description:
OpenCRVS Product Development involves:
- Maintaining the OpenCRVS code base
- Addressing bugs found in country implementations
- Resolving technical debt and critical open source dependencies.
- Curating GitHub issues to attract contributions from the external developer community.

plans.name: Fellowship Plan
plans.description: Fellowship program to support and mentor an individual contributing to OpenCRVS for 12 months.

plans.name: Innovation Plan
plans.description: Financial prize for an innovation competition, incentivizing participation from low-income countries e.g., developing new interoperability use cases for OpenCRVS.
